thread.title: Trengove plots course to Rio Olympics
thread.title_full: Trengove plots course to Rio Olympics

author: WARREN PARTLAND
title: Trengove plots course to Rio Olympics
text:
Planning a path to Rio ... Jessica Trengove. Picture: Robert Cianflone (Getty Images)
WARREN PARTLAND The Advertiser SOUTH Australia’s distance running star Jessica Trengove is to plot a course for the Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games after all but cementing a trip to Brazil with an emphatic Melbourne Marathon victory on Sunday.
The world half marathon in Wales in March is an enticing option, while Trengove must decide whether to contest another marathon before the Rio Games in August.
Trengove clocked a personal best 2hr27min45sec, the sixth fastest time ever by an Australian female.
Second on the list is another South Australian, Lisa Ondieki with 2:23.51.
Now Trengove must decided how to build for Rio.
“I had not planned a schedule beyond Melbourne,’’ Trengove said.
“I wanted to tick that box and now we have to decide what is the best approach.
“The option is to run another marathon in March or April or I could do a couple of half marathons and rely on tough training blocks.
“After the Glasgow Commonweallth Games (third in the marathon last year) I had a chance to break up my program.
“I focused on different distances and on the 10km. I ran a big PB on the track.’’
Trengove has been based in Melbourne since January but will return to Adelaide to prepare for Rio.
She said she had pulled up well from the stunning Melbourne Marathon performance.
Her calf muscles were “OK” although there was some tightness in the quads and a beach recovery session was on the agenda on Monday.
AUSTRALIA’S FASTEST FEMALE MARATHONERS
1. Benita Willis — 2:22:36; Oct. 22, 2006 Chicago
2. Lisa Ondieki — 2:23:51; Oct. 31, 1988 Osaka
3. Nickey Carroll — 2:25:51; Apr. 18, 1999 London
4. Kerry McCann — 2:25:59; Apr. 16, 2000 London
5. Lisa Weightman — 2:26:05; Oct. 13, 2013 Melbourne
6. Jess Trengove — 2:27:45; Oct. 18, 2015 Melbourne
7. Kate Smyth — 2:28:51; Apr. 19, 2008 Nagano AAP jds/wk
